decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the board through a combination of counterspells and removal spells, while also utilizing card advantage and card selection. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Counterspell, while also removing threats with cards like Putrefy, Innocent Blood, and Go for the Throat. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and control, while Standstill helps to slow down the opponent's aggression. The deck also includes land destruction with Wasteland and creature lands like Mishra's Factory and Mutavault for additional threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Careful Study, Entomb, and Reanimate, in order to bring them back onto the battlefield for a low cost. By combining powerful creatures like Blazing Archon, Iona, Shield of Emeria, Sphinx of the Steel Wind, and Inkwell Leviathan with the reanimation spells, you can overwhelm your opponent with massive threats early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to protect your combo pieces and ensure your opponent can't stop your game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant alongside disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize to apply pressure and control the board. The inclusion of powerful planeswalker Jace, the Mind Sculptor adds another dimension to the deck's strategy. With a mix of card advantage, removal, and disruption, this deck aims to outvalue and overpower opponents in a midrange shell. The mana denial provided by Wasteland and the potential threat of Terravore make it a strong contender in a Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, triggering the Dredge mechanic to bring back powerful creatures like Ichorid and Narcomoeba. By utilizing cards like Cabal Therapy and Dread Return, the deck can quickly assemble a combo to overwhelm the opponent with an army of creatures. This deck aims to maximize graveyard recursion and combo potential to achieve a quick and decisive victory.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and pressure the opponent by deploying aggressive creatures such as Tarmogoyf and Vendilion Clique. This is supported by ramp creatures like Noble Hierarch to accelerate into powerful threats like Progenitus through cards like Natural Order. The deck also features disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to protect its creatures and control the opponent's board. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed, power, and disruption.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and efficient removal spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to deploy strong, efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary early in the game, supported by cards like Noble Hierarch and Wild Nacatl to ramp up mana. The inclusion of impactful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile helps to control the opponent's board and clear the way for your creatures to attack. This deck aims to apply consistent pressure and close out the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck aims to quickly and efficiently cheat out powerful threats, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Progenitus, onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It also includes a suite of blue disruption spells like Force of Will and Misdirection to protect its combo pieces. The deck also runs cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to help find its combo pieces and ensure a smooth draw. The mana base is designed to provide quick access to the necessary colors of mana for casting its spells.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with creatures like Lord of Atlantis and Merrow Reejerey, while using disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will to control the game. Aether Vial allows for creatures to be played at instant speed, while Standstill can provide card advantage if opponents choose to break it. Mutavault and Wasteland provide additional utility and disruption, making this deck a powerful and consistent aggro option in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to generate large amounts of mana using High Tide and Turnabout, in order to cast powerful spells such as Brain Freeze and Cunning Wish. The deck includes various card draw and search spells to help assemble the combo pieces quickly and protect them with Counterspells like Force of Will and Mental Misstep. The goal is to generate enough mana to either mill the opponent's library with Brain Freeze or access a sideboarded win condition with Cunning Wish. The deck aims to win through sheer card advantage and mana efficiency.

The deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Tarmogoyf to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent with cards like Aven Mindcensor and Wasteland. It also has a strong equipment package with Batterskull, Sword of Feast and Famine, and Umezawa's Jitte to provide additional threats and value. The deck aims to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while building a strong board presence to quickly close out the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt your opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The key strategy involves playing Standstill to draw extra cards while forcing your opponent to make the first move, all while utilizing powerful planeswalkers and board wipes to maintain dominance on the battlefield. The inclusion of powerful control cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Force of Will ensures that you can maintain control of the game and outmaneuver your opponent until you secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to use the card Show and Tell to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Progenitus onto the battlefield early in the game. The deck also includes cards like Sneak Attack and Seething Song to help ramp up mana quickly and support the combo. With a mix of control cards like Force of Will and Daze, along with card selection from Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with its massive threats before they have a chance to respond.

The main concept of this Merfolk aggro deck is to quickly assemble a board of powerful Merfolk creatures and use disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Mental Misstep to control the game. With lords like Lord of Atlantis boosting the power of the tribe and cards like Aether Vial allowing for rapid deployment of creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient beats and counter any threats they may pose. The deck also includes utility creatures like Kira, Great Glass-Spinner to protect key creatures and disrupt opposing removal spells.

The core idea of this Merfolk aggro deck is to leverage a strong mana base and disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Mental Misstep to control the game while building an aggressive board presence with creatures like Coralhelm Commander, Lord of Atlantis, and Merrow Reejerey. By using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and utilizing powerful tribal synergies, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with efficient threats and disruptive tempo plays in order to secure victory.

This Legacy Merfolk deck focuses on rapidly deploying a board of aggressive Merfolk creatures with the help of Aether Vial while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze. Cards like Lord of Atlantis and Merrow Reejerey provide buffs to the Merfolk tribe, making them even more threatening. Standstill provides card advantage while punishing opponents for playing spells, creating a tempo advantage for the Merfolk player. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently with a mix of creatures, disruption, and card advantage.

The deck focuses on cheating powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Progenitus into play quickly through the use of cards like "Show and Tell" and "Natural Order." The deck also includes protection spells like "Force of Will" and "Daze" to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, mana acceleration from cards like "Birds of Paradise" and "Noble Hierarch" help ramp up to the combo pieces quickly. The inclusion of lands like "Boseiju, Who Shelters All" ensures that important spells can't be countered, making for a strong and efficient combo strategy.
